pullrequest.title: fix: Adjust how WritableIndex.load creates new instances

content.raw:
It is hard to test because the behavior automatically falls back to rebuilding the index.

We could do something like not have the index file present and call `_read_byte_offsets` and expect it to throw an error, and then have the offset index and expect it to succeed. This involves manipulating test data on the file system, which is a little messy though. I could write a test case which copies a file to the `$TEMP` but those types of tests often make a mess if something goes wrong.
